content: You are good at finding the object in a 3D scene based on a given query description.

These images show different views of a room. You need to find the chair in this query description: "you are looking for the chair closest to the front. it is on the right side, right behind the chair leg.". 
Please review all view images to find the target object and select the view that you can see the target object most clearly. 
Output your answer in JSON format with these keys: 
"reasoning": Explain how you identified the target object, and why you choose this view.
"view": The number of the view is in the top left corner of the corresponding image. e.g., "view": "2"

The query describes a chair closest to the front on the right side, right behind the chair leg. In view 3, the room is shown from a top-down perspective, clearly displaying the arrangement of chairs around the table. The chair on the right side closest to the front is visible in this view, making it the most suitable for identifying the target object.

Here is the annotated image of the selected view. 
All objects belonging to the chair class is labeled by a unique number (ID) in red color on it.
Please select the object ID that best matches the given query description: "you are looking for the chair closest to the front. it is on the right side, right behind the chair leg.".
Carefully analyze the specified conditions (such as shape, color, relative position with surrounding objects) in the given query, then select top-5 best-matched object IDs.
The selected top-5 object IDs should be sorted in descending order of confidence.
The object ID should be chosen from this list [2, 3, 4, 5, 8, 9, 10, 11, 12, 13, 34, 43]
Output your answer in JSON format with these keys: 
"reasoning": Explain how you identified and ranked the top-5 target object IDs.
"object_id": A list of5 selected target object IDs. e.g., [1, 2, 3, 4, 5]

The query describes a chair closest to the front, on the right side, right behind the chair leg. In the image, the front is the bottom part. The right side from this perspective is the right side of the table. The chair closest to the front on the right side is ID 9. It is directly behind the front chair leg. The next closest chairs on the right side are IDs 8, 10, 12, and 3, in that order.
